summary: VICE PRESIDENT Executive Profile Accomplished at building and sustaining outstanding teams. Creates a team vision that supports the organizational vision. Skilled at turning teams into industry leading teams and developing team members into outstanding performers. Develops innovative approaches to providing high quality, cost-effective service that exceed customer expectations. Skilled author and speaker with numerous articles appearing in national business journals and multiple presentations at national conferences.

experience.title: Vice President
experience.description: VICE PRESIDENT Executive Profile Accomplished at building and sustaining outstanding teams. Creates a team vision that supports the organizational vision. Skilled at turning teams into industry leading teams and developing team members into outstanding performers. Develops innovative approaches to providing high quality, cost-effective service that exceed customer expectations. Skilled author and speaker with numerous articles appearing in national business journals and multiple presentations at national conferences. Selected positions included Chair of United Way Mental Health and Counseling Grant Panel (2009) and Vice-Chair of Access to Jobs Panel (2010â€“2012).

experience.title: Corporate Director
experience.description: Coordinated multiple medical equipment service departments into a single system department. Led effort to implement medical equipment management database that combined six separate databases. Participated in development and implementation of automated on-line capital acquisition request process. Developed system-wide process for identifying medical equipment in need of replacement. Member of Information Services Leadership Council and Information Services Communications Council. Co-chaired Baylor Clinical Technology Assessment Council. Active participant in developing relationship with Medisend for medical equipment and supplies to developing countries; helped develop internship program to assist BMETs from those countries. Primary contact for Baylor Health Care System executive leadership for information systems technology issues. Directed activities of Technology Operations, Field Support and Desktop Engineering, and Biomedical Technology Services.

experience.title: Operations Manager
experience.description: Participated in implementation of Clinical Engineering program that maintained a high level of quality and customer satisfaction while beating budget targets by $1.6 million, and reduced cost of previous outsourced program by approximately $7.5 million during its first three years. Assisted in development and shared responsibility for ongoing maintenance of department intranet site. Participated in successful Y2K compliance for about 35,000 pieces of equipment. Participated in development of a Strategic Technology Plan for major imaging equipment in 2000; plan later expanded to all clinical equipment valued over $25,000.

experience.title: Team Manager and Regional Manager
experience.description: Team Manager and Regional Manager responsibilities included leading regional teams within clinical technology management.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Electronic Engineering Technology
